thread.title: Tesla owners can now see if Superchargers are occupied
thread.title_full: Tesla owners can now see if Superchargers are occupied - The Verge

author: Jordan Golson
title: Tesla owners can now see if Superchargers are occupied
text:
Tesla owners can now use their navigation screens to see how many spaces are open at Supercharger stations. It’s a small but sure-to-be-appreciated change that should reduce the frustration of making a detour to a Supercharger, only to find all the charging stalls filled up. The information is available in the map app of the center screen in Model S and Model X vehicles.
Late last year, Tesla began charging a fee to owners who left their cars at Superchargers after they had completed charging. The fee — which is $0.40 cents per minute in the US if a car remains at a station for more than five minutes after charging is completed — is meant to encourage turnover at Tesla’s charging facilities.
@elonmusk @ElonMuskNewsOrg brilliant update to Tesla Sat Nav charger info. #topteam #tesla #supercharger #dundee #Acleanfuture pic.twitter.com/yDDb3uV52P 
— John van Dieken (@doubledutch13) February 8, 2017
